intro: Hazardia obtusa, commonly known as the narrowleaf hazardia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and linear, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Hazardia obtusa is adapted to arid conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
